I have The Empress consumable and two Hanging Chads, which re-trigger a card. The Empress needs to be used on two cards. Stuntman gives a solid +300 Chips.

The goal is 22,000 chips. I think this play can get me there. If I enhance the Ace and Queen into Mult cards with "The Empress" they'll be fantastic.

I'm ready to use the consumable.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.

reasoning:
**Analysis and Action: Round 11 - The Head**

Alright, let's break this down. Ante 5/8, Boss "The Head", debuffing Spades, which thanks to Smeared Joker means Clubs are also useless. I need 22,000 chips; I'm currently at 14,336, leaving me 7,664 to grab. Only three hands remain and I have two discards. My hand is a bit of a mess: a debuffed 2 of Spades and debuffed Ace of Clubs, plus a Jack, 9, and 8 of Hearts, and a 4 of Diamonds. The Ancient Joker is useless this round because Spades/Clubs are debuffed. Stuntman is great for a guaranteed 300 chip boost, and those Hanging Chads will make the first played card count 5 times!

My immediate thought is to build a Flush. Even with the debuffed cards, a Flush is the way to go. I can build a High Card hand with the Jack, it'll net me 730 chips (not good enough). A Flush, however, could be powerful. I can get about 3,500 chips, so I need to go for something BIGGER!

My primary focus is on drawing Hearts or Diamonds to complete a Flush. The remaining deck composition is crucial, with more Aces, Kings, Queens, or even better Jacks. Discarding the debuffed cards is a no-brainer. But I only have 2 discards, and a hand size of 6, and I want a hand that'll generate 7,664. So I *must* discard the debuffed cards. But how aggressively to do so? Do I just keep what I have and hope for the best? No, discarding to maximize my chances of getting Hearts or Diamonds is the only way.

Initially, I'm thinking to discard just the debuffed cards (2S and AC), but it would be better to discard the lowest-value cards to maximize my odds of hitting big. I could get a solid three of a kind, but a Flush is more promising, especially with high cards. With only 6 cards, if I discard 2, I only draw 2. This does not have good odds. If I discard 3 or 4, I can make a solid hand. I need to get rid of debuffed cards, and low-value cards.

Let's discard the debuffed cards, the Ace and 2 of Spades and see what happens. The Smeared Joker means if I can get a flush, I can keep those suits the same.

The math, and probability is showing me to discard 4 cards. I keep the Jack of Hearts, and try to get the other 4.

I have 3 Aces left in the deck, plus kings and queens. Discarding is crucial. A Flush of high cards, maybe with a King or Ace would be incredible.

The priority is drawing Hearts/Diamonds. I still have the Jack of Hearts. Let's discard the low-value and debuffed cards.

**Action: Discard**

**Positions: \[1, 3, 4, 5, 6]** (2 of Spades, 9 of Hearts, 8 of Hearts, Ace of Clubs, 4 of Diamonds), keeping the Jack of Hearts.

This is the play. It's time. Let's see what we get!
